alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 9:50AM CDT until March 31 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, State Highway 216 affected. Extensive acreage near Harris Brake Lake and the Wildlife Management Area are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday morning and continue falling to 24.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 29.2 Sun 8 AM 28.7 27.8 26.4 **CRESTING** &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
